page.title: 16WHAT DISAPPEARS IN NORTHOLT?
page.content: {Northolt Park Station}was built as a halt for Northolt Race Course. The racecourse has now become a housing estate but the station is a convenient way of getting into Central London for South Harrow and Northolt commuters. {The booking clerk}at Northolt Park has been there for five years. Before that he worked as a signalman. He has to take care of the station as well as selling tickets. Although his work requires training, he insists that an important part of his work depends on dealing well with people. The booking clerk has to be at the station at 6.30 a.m. {The train driver}has a much longer training. When he began his work there used to be steam trains on this line. Now all the locomotives are diesel and are a lot faster.
